comment: Not a bad one, definitely a pass. I mean you get what you pay for honestly.
Meh, taste is something OK, but I would better buy myself a steak and a cold beer rather then this whiskey.
Corn syrup, very weak but with too much burn.
I was surprised by how much I like good ole Jim Beam. Lots of flavor (it almost strikes me as rye-like), and pretty smooth for a cheap bourbon. It’s one of my go-to bottles for a casual drink.

My first bourbon. The color is more hazel than golden. A little bit unusual nose. Something cereal and corny. Taste with the same notes, plus sweet and light vanilla. Finish is smooth, sweetness, but a little alcoholic. Probably will be better with ice. Recognizable and advertised bottle design, but I don't like it. Summary: nothing special, suitable for the friend company or if you want to get drunk :)
Sweet, acrid nose. Spicy, bitter, burn.
Honestly not much going on. Almost no taste at all. Not offensive in any way, just bland.
Decent all arround, very good for the price.

I'm working through some of the entry level bourbons out of curiosity and I find myself at Jim Beam. I smell sugar and alcohol at first, but take a sip and it turns to a sour wood smell. The first sip is woody and unrefined; it tastes like what it is... cheap bourbon. It might be shot worthy, but sipping my way though it I'm not finding much of interest. I can't see using this in any bourbon forward cocktail. Mixing in ginger beer to cover it up seems to emphasize the rougher aspects of this one without improving it. I can't see ever seeking this one out or drinking it as anything more than a shot with a beer when it's the only option.

Nose: weak; vanilla, Apple

Taste: somewhat sweet, vanilla, slight Apple fruit taste

Finish: hint of cinnamon, oak

This review of Jim Beam Original (White Label) is a simple head-to-head tasting against Evan Williams Black Label - two bottom shelf, entry level, budget bourbons that can be found pretty much anywhere.  This head-to-head was inspired by a bar nearby... but that's a tidbit I'll discuss in my subsequent review for EW Black Label.  Let's get to the details of this bottle!

Mash Bill: 75% Corn, 13% Rye, 12% Malted Barley
Age: NAS (but at least 4 years)
ABV: 40%
Price: $9.99 ( typically $10-$17)

Nose: Weak.  Vaguely sweet, watery caramel corn.  Thin vanilla, spice, and herbal notes.  The zest of underripe oranges and some musty undertones reminiscent of peanut shells.  It's so watery, I don't want to say the nose has "heat", so let's just say it has more ethanol than I'd like to detect at this proof. 

Palate: Anyone there?  This dram is packed with about as enthusiasm as store brand, budget vanilla ice cream or plain mashed potatoes.  Thin and watery.  The sweetness leans more towards confectioners' sugar than granulated. More watery vanilla, bits of wood, and faint herbal notes. 

Finish: Very short.  Watery caramel, corn, and faint oaky astringency. 

Verdict:  Well, I would pick this over JD.  While that may not be saying much, it costs about half of what JD costs so that's a fair bit of VFM swinging in its favor.  However, as will be detailed in my next review, I would ultimately pick EW Black over this if I had to pick a ~$10 bottle of bourbon.  

2.5 ~ 72 ~ Below Average

Honey, toasted caramel, wood, vanilla, sweet.. Great inmeadiate taste, very short after taste.. Very dry, not too much evolution.. For Its price Its a good whisky, I repeat "for Its price"

Follow me on insta: @whiskperience
A pretty smooth drink, nice consistent flavor with some vanilla sweetness on the back end and just a little bit of burn. Definitely not a stand out but it's fairly pleasant to me.

Not your typical bourbon. Smells a bit like chemicals, but thankfully that goes away on the taste. VERY light flavor, with a bit of woody bite in the back. It’s kind of impressive how bad this doesn’t taste considering how young it must be. It’s fine in a pinch (which I’m currently in, thanks Covid), but I wouldn’t even want to use it in cocktails, because there’s just no backbone to it.

Faint apple scent on the nose. 
Sweet apple spice on the palate.
Short spice finish.

Bitişi tatlı
Not a bad bourbon for the price
Way to bitter, unnecessary ending taste of sour and sweetness.
Corn, oak, peanuts. I get a red fruit as well. I really like it for the price and availability.
One of my favorites for everyday drinks

Some folks turn their noses up at original JB. That's okay because it just leaves more for me. There is a reason why this has been around for such a long time. It...Just...Works. One of my favorite pours.

My first Bourbon, didn't like it. On the nose you get acetone, oakyness and a little smoke. On the palate is very hot. Not sweet at all, there are some wine-raising notes there somewhere. Very hoy finish, tends to be alike some Usa whiskeys, where you can find wine-grapes-raising notes on the palate and in the nose but totally inferior. Worst whisky so far
Sweet as candy (bubblegum?), fruity and nice touch of caramel. Surprisingly good for the price.

Nose - ethanol, caramel, vanilla. 

Taste - vanilla, caramel, maple, sea salt, finishing quick and sweet.

Totally middle of the road. Not terrible, but nothing interesting or exciting. Corn, cereal, and sweetness on the nose, and the same with maybe a little bit of peanut on the palate. Fine to mix, passable if drinking neat, wouldn't seek out to buy, but would accept a drink if offered.
Not a bad drink for the price point.  But not my first choice.  Kind of like the McDonalds of bourbon.  Cheap and gets the job done without being offensive.  Tasted neat.
Caramel, wood, vanilla with some peanut nuttiness. The flavors are nice but barely there. For budget bourbons,  I’ll stick with EW BiB.
Palate and nose vaguely vanilla. Some pepper. Light wood note as the taste lingers. When diluted by ice actually a light flash of orange on palate.

Nose: Vanilla, Oak, spice, dried fruits, hint of tobacco

Palate: Vanilla, Oak, hint of spice

Finish: Quick wash of sweetness, oak and spice
The nose of this is actually very pleasant, oaky with honey notes, but then you taste it...very weak and nothing notable, there's nothing to keep you coming back

Classic bourbon flavor full of corn

Mixer, not a sipper

Tired of ordering a jack and coke? Want to take something to a party without looking pretentious? Ready for COVID-19 to be over so we can get back to tailgates and SEC football? Whatever red-solo-cup function you're at, have this with you to mix with whatever is near by.

There is no mistaking the very familiar Beam nose in this. The flavors start sweet, corny & a bit of grain but the proof keeps everything short & subtle. Not bad but not good enough to be a daily drinker for me.
Sweet, but not a distinct flavor profile. Short lived. Almost a Smokey quality..
Good tasting bourbon especially for the price

Nose is faint.  Mostly alcohol with vanilla and cherry.  Possibly baked bread slightly.  Taste is corn, corn, and corn.  Very sweet and mouthfeel is thin.  Finish is smooth, brief, and unremarkable.  This whiskey is very easy drinking and would be a good base for a ginger highball.
Sweet and little sour with smooth finish
Sweet start, but finish was quick
Heavy ethanol notes and terrible headache in the morning

Nose - Sweet, maraschino cherry, vanilla
Palate - Sweet, solvent
Finish - Short
43% ABV

Add a block of ice to lower the solvent taste and make this drinkable.
Sweet and thin to me, doesn’t last long on the palate
Classic bourbon. Vanilla, caramel, oak, cherry or red apples on the nose. Wood bite and sour on the pallate.
I like it. It’s really sweet, not much of an aftertaste. Vanilla tasting notes
Used it in a recipe for baked beans, then drank the rest.  Nothing great or complex.  But not bad either.

Poured neat. Nose is sweet and bready. Initial taste is burnt sugar and the finish is quick with a smokey and slightly nutty aftertaste. All around reasonable flavor so it's fine to sip on, but not as complex as I would like in a daily go-to. This bourbon has no shame being alone in the glass or mixed into your favorite cocktail.
Medium honey color. Smell tinge of Smokey and honey. Sweet taste (honey and caramel). Smooth. Would buy!
